name: CreateNewApp
description:
Create a new app and return its ID using Datadog.

Use this tool to create a new app in Datadog. Ensure you have a registered application key or configured permissions in the UI before calling this tool.

parameters.name: app_definition
parameters.description: JSON object defining the app's name, description, components, and other attributes.

name.description: The triggering action for the event.

events.description: Events to listen for on the grid component.

id.description: The ID of the grid component. This property is deprecated; use `name` to identify individual components instead.

name.description: A unique identifier for this grid component. This name is also visible in the app editor.

backgroundColor.description: The background color of the grid.

name.description: The triggering action for the event.

events.description: Events to listen for on the UI component.

id.description: The ID of the UI component. This property is deprecated; use `name` to identify individual components instead.

name.description: A unique identifier for this UI component. This name is also visible in the app editor.

children.description: The child components of the UI component.

isVisible.description: Whether the UI component is visible. If this is a string, it must be a valid JavaScript expression that evaluates to a boolean.

properties.description: Properties of a UI component. Different component types can have their own additional unique properties. See the [components documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/service_management/app_builder/components/) for more detail on each component type and its properties.

children.description: The child components of the grid.

isVisible.description: Whether the grid component and its children are visible. If a string, it must be a valid JavaScript expression that evaluates to a boolean.

components.description: The UI components that make up the app.

description.description: A human-readable description for the app.

queries.description: An array of queries, such as external actions and state variables, that the app uses.

rootInstanceName.description: The name of the root component of the app. This must be a `grid` component that contains all other components.

tags.description: A list of tags for the app, which can be used to filter apps.

attributes.description: App definition attributes such as name, description, and components.

data.description: The data object containing the app definition.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.
